subject: Psychology
title: Cognitive Dissonance
description: Learn Cognitive Dissonance in one minute.

hook.text: You buy an expensive car you can't afford, then convince yourself it was a wise investment. That's dissonance at work.

buildup.text: Festinger's cognitive dissonance theory says we feel discomfort when our actions contradict our beliefs.

discovery.text: To reduce that discomfort, we change our beliefs to match our actions rather than admitting the mistake.

twist.text: In the $1 vs $20 experiment, people paid less changed their beliefs more. Less justification, more dissonance.

climax.text: Dissonance explains why people defend bad decisions, stay in harmful relationships, and resist changing their minds.

punchline.text: When actions clash with beliefs, beliefs bend first.

quiz.question: What is cognitive dissonance?
options: Discomfort from holding contradictory beliefs and actions
